qas.question: At the start of the war, which country did European public opinion champion?
In which city did many Italians attempt to proffer their services to the Prussian embassy?
What caused a dramatic shift in Italian sentiment toward the war?

answers.text: Bismarck's demand for the return of Alsace

qas.question: To whom is the quote, "Rescue the French Republic by every means" attributed?
What army did Garibaldi gain command of in France?

context: When the war had begun, European public opinion heavily favored <a0_0>the Germans<a0_0/>; many Italians attempted to sign up as volunteers at the Prussian embassy in <a1_0>Florence<a1_0/> and a Prussian diplomat visited Giuseppe Garibaldi in Caprera. <a2_0>Bismarck's demand for the return of Alsace<a2_0/> caused a dramatic shift in that sentiment in Italy, which was best exemplified by the reaction of <a3_0>Garibaldi<a3_0/> soon after the revolution in Paris, who told the Movimento of Genoa on 7 September 1870 that "Yesterday I said to you: war to the death to Bonaparte. Today I say to you: rescue the French Republic by every means." Garibaldi went to France and assumed command of <a4_0>the Army of the Vosges<a4_0/>, with which he operated around Dijon till the end of the war.
